ratings.comment: Has an ego. Class is super easy if you pay attention and do the reading, but he surely has an ego. He tends to be condensing sometimes, and is more worried about you being 5 minutes late to class rather than the actual work you do.

Alagna was amazing! He's a great Spanish teacher who loves teaching his language. Be ready to complete homework for every class, it is apart of your final grade! There are 2 compositions, and 4 exams with 3 quiz's. Lots of grammar content but if you study (or took Spanish in highschool) you should be fine!
Professor Alagna was enthusiastic and encouraging. He made a great effort to keep us engaged with the content during a semester that wasn't ideal.

I was not a fan of the type of teaching style that was given. Expecting a 101 class to gain knowledge of a language very quickly is not acceptable and not fair. It is something new and shouldn't be thrown at us all at once. It is unfair for the students that didn't take any Spanish in high school and had to struggle catching up.

Really great class experience so far. In a higher level of Spanish a lot of the kids have different types of experience. Some kids are practically fluent and others have terrible accents. But, he grades everyone in the class on how much they've progressed, not how much they knew before. Hilarious guy and very reasonable, would take again.

Professor Alagna was a very solid Spanish professor. Spanish 226 was restructured this year and was filled with mounds of homework. Mr. Alagna made this class bearable by following grading rubrics and meeting with students outside of class to review major assignment.

It's probably just the curriculum that made this class suck, but this guy didn't help one bit. His favorite thing to say was, "Well, it's hard to explain.. It just sounds right." Which might be funny once or twice, but when that's his answer to 50% of questions asked, you're in trouble.

Hey was an Amazing TA! I would definitely take a class with him again.  He really cares that you do well and is willing to put in extra work to help you! No final exam which was really nice just 6 quizzes (similar to short tests) and you can drop one. I would recommend him to everyone! Funny, cute and nice

Giosue is a native Spanish speaker and so it seemed like he thought the class was easier than it was. He relies heavily on the textbook and didn't really make lesson plans of his own. Good class overall.

There must be a difference here for when he teaches Italian vs Spanish -- Usually not very prepared to answer questions, talks too fast for a 2nd-semester-level comprehension, and acts as if everyone taking the class is in it to major in Italian. Lots of busy work. He's fine if you actually NEED to learn Italian, otherwise look elsewhere.
Great guy and great teacher, funny and down to earth

He is a good guy, but thinks the class is so easy that everyone should get an A, when harldy anyone gets and A. 93 percent for an A, no extra credit. Grammar is easy, literature and culture readings more difficult.
Awesome TA!  Funny, down to earth, and likes to have a good time.  He jokes a lot and makes spanish fun.  Highly recommended
Easy to understand. Easygoing. Not too much homework
The man knows what he's talking about. He stresses how Spanish is spoken in the real world- not just what the textbooks give us. Incredibly helpful and friendly. Chau
